description:
This was observed in the Juno release.

Because targeted live and cold migrations do not go through the scheduler for policy-based decision making, a VM could be migrated to a host that would violate the policy of the server-group.

If a VM belongs to a server group, the group policy will need to be checked in the compute manager at the time of migration to ensure that:
1. VMs in a server group with affinity rule can't be migrated.
2. VMs in a server group with anti-affinity rule don't move to a host that would violate the rule.
title: targeted migrations/evacuations skip scheduler validation

comments.content:
This was observed in the Juno release.

Because targeted live and cold migrations do not go through the scheduler for policy-based decision making, a VM could be migrated to a host that would violate the policy of the server-group.

If a VM belongs to a server group, the group policy will need to be checked in the compute manager at the time of migration to ensure that:
1. VMs in a server group with affinity rule can't be migrated.
2. VMs in a server group with anti-affinity rule don't move to a host that would violate the rule.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jmulsow

comments.content:
This bug is a more general issue which is a whole bunch of targeted moving operations don't go through the scheduler to validate the decision. This historically has been somewhat intentional, since these operations are reserved for admins who should know what they are doing. That being said it would be nice to have a mode for these targeted moves that validates the move with the scheduler.   I think this work will have to wait until L as we are trying to pull out the scheduler in Kilo.

In the meantime one possible improvement we can make is have a separate policy.json entry  (http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/etc/nova/policy.json) for targeted moves (evacuate/migrate etc).   So operators can choose to further restrict who has access to these operations (and even disable them).
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jogo

comments.content:
I would rephrase ' 1. VMs in a server group with affinity rule can't be migrated' as 
'1. VMs in a server group with affinity rule can be migrated only with all other VMs in that affinity group that run on this host'
This would require support by the API and CLI tools for specifying multiple instances to be migrated at the same time. Without this migrating a server in an affinity rule will always fail.

It would be good to add an option to the boot command to disable a particular or all scheduling filters. But that should probably go as a separate ticket.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~guzenkovsn

comments.content:
This is an old feature request (= "wishlist" bug report) which 
wasn't able to draw enough attention for an implementation. Also, 
the effort to implement this needs to be driven by a blueprint + spec 
file. I'm closing it as "Opinion".

If you want to work on this, consider reading [1] and create a blueprint
at [2] and a spec-file at [3]. If you need assistance, reach out on the
IRC channel #openstack-nova or use the mailing list.

References:
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Blueprints
[2] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/
[3] https://github.com/openstack/nova-specs
